required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of Systane® ULTRA Compared to OPTIVE® in Ocular Surface Staining
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of Systane® ULTRA Compared to OPTIVE® in Ocular Surface Staining

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare Systane® ULTRA lubricant eye drops to OPTIVE® lubricating eye drops for ocular surface staining within dry eye subjects and to evaluate the safety of Systane® ULTRA after 3 months of use.

detailed_description.textblock: Following a 2-week washout phase with saline eye drops, subjects were randomized to receive either Systane® ULTRA or OPTIVE® for the remainder of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Total Ocular Surface Staining (TOSS) Score at Day 35 (Phase I)
primary_outcome.description: The TOSS score is a composite score of corneal fluorescein staining, nasal conjunctival lissamine green staining, and temporal conjunctival lissamine green staining, each scored on a 0-5 Likert scale (0=absent, 5=severe). TOSS scores can range from 0 to 15. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) Score at Day 35 (Phase I)
secondary_outcome.description: The OSDI is a 12-item, quality of life questionnaire that evaluates symptoms based on 3 modules (type of discomfort, environmental triggers, and tasking) on a 0-4 Likert scale (0=None of the time, 4=All of the time). A resultant overall 0-100 score was calculated, where 0=No disability and 100=Complete disability. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Impact of Dry Eye on Everyday Life (IDEEL) Treatment Effectiveness Score at Day 35 (Phase I)
secondary_outcome.description: The IDEEL is a 10-item, patient-reported questionnaire used to measure treatment satisfaction. The subject answered 4 questions pertaining to treatment effectiveness scored on a 0-4 Likert-type scale, where 0=None of the time, 1=A little of the time, 2=Some of the time, 3=Most of the time, and 4=All of the time. The IDEEL score for treatment effectiveness was calculated based upon the mean value of the 4 questions multiplied by 25, for a resultant overall score of 0-100, where 0=Complete disability and 100=No disability. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Impact of Dry Eye on Everyday Life (IDEEL) Treatment Inconvenience Score at Day 35 (Phase I)
secondary_outcome.description: The IDEEL is a 10-item, patient-reported questionnaire used to measure treatment satisfaction. The subject answered 4 questions pertaining to treatment inconvenience scored on a 0-4 Likert-type scale, where 0=All of the time, 1=Most of the time, 2=Some of the time, 3=A little of the time, and 4=None of the time. The IDEEL score for treatment inconvenience was calculated based upon the mean value of the 4 questions multiplied by 25, for a resultant overall score of 0-100, where 0=Complete disability and 100=No disability. Both eyes contributed to the analysis.

arm_group.description: Systane® ULTRA lubricant eyedrops, 1 drop in each eye 4 times a day for 35 days (Phase I), followed by 55 days additional use as needed (Phase II).
OPTIVE® lubricating eyedrops, 1 drop in each eye 4 times a day for 35 days (Phase I), followed by 55 days additional use as needed (Phase II).

intervention.description: 1 drop in each eye, 4 times a day, for up to two weeks as washout prior to Phase I and Phase II.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing and able to attend all study visits.
- Diagnosis of dry eye, as specified in protocol.
- Uses artificial tears, as specified in protocol.
- Other protocol-defined inclusion criteria may apply.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor visual acuity, as specified in protocol.
- Women of childbearing potential who are pregnant, lactating, or not using adequate birth control, as specified in protocol.
- Any hypersensitivity or allergy to the investigational products or ingredients.
- Any eye disorder, ocular surgery, medication, medical condition, or systemic disease, as specified in protocol.
- Contact lens use within 2 weeks of Screening Visit.
- Other protocol-defined exclusion criteria may apply.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 13 study centers located in France and 3 study centers located in Germany.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 105 enrolled, 11 subjects were exited prior to randomization: 9 screen failures, 1 adverse event, and 1 lost to follow-up. This reporting group includes all randomized subjects (94).

baseline.population: This analysis group includes all randomized subjects.

measure.title: Mean Total Ocular Surface Staining (TOSS) Score
measure.description: The TOSS score is a composite score of corneal fluorescein staining, nasal conjunctival lissamine green staining, and temporal conjunctival lissamine green staining, each scored on a 0-5 Likert scale (0=absent, 5=severe). TOSS scores can range from 0 to 15. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis. Here, the analysis group includes all randomized subjects with data at visit (46,47 respectively, for a total of 93).

outcome.description: The TOSS score is a composite score of corneal fluorescein staining, nasal conjunctival lissamine green staining, and temporal conjunctival lissamine green staining, each scored on a 0-5 Likert scale (0=absent, 5=severe). TOSS scores can range from 0 to 15. One eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
outcome.population: This analysis group includes all randomized subjects with data at visit.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected for the duration of the study (Sep 2013 - Jun 2014). AEs are reported as pre-treatment and treatment-emergent. One subject was randomized to Optive, but was never exposed to product.
reported_events.desc: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a subject who was administered an investigational product regardless of whether or not the event had a causal relationship with the product. AEs were obtained as solicited and spontaneous comments from the study subjects, and as observations by the Investigator, as outlined in the protocol.

group.title: Pre-treatment
group.description: All subjects who consented to participate in the study prior to exposure to investigational product

group.title: Systane Ultra
group.description: All subjects who were exposed to Systane Ultra or run-in therapy

group.title: Optive
group.description: All subjects who were exposed to Optive or run-in therapy

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor reserves the right of prior review of any publication or presentation of information related to the study.
